title: 2012–13 Frauen-Bundesliga
text:
The 2012–13 season of the <a href="Frauen-Bundesliga">Frauen-Bundesliga</a> was the 23rd season of Germany's premier women's <a href="Association%20football">football</a> league. The season began on 1 September 2012 and ended on 12 May 2013. <a href="1.%20FFC%20Turbine%20Potsdam">Turbine Potsdam</a> were the defending champions.
The title was won by <a href="VfL%20Wolfsburg%20%28women%29">VfL Wolfsburg</a> for the first time. Turbine Potsdam finished in second place and qualified to the <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">UEFA Women's Champions League</a>.
Duisburg and Bad Neuenahr went into administration during the season. As a result, Bad Neuenahr decided to withdraw from the league, sparing Sindelfingen relegation.
Changes from 2011–12.
SG Essen-Schönebeck was renamed to <a href="SGS%20Essen">SGS Essen</a> and now play their home games in the <a href="Stadion%20Essen">Stadion Essen</a>.
Teams.
The teams promoted from the previous season's 2nd Bundesliga were <a href="VfL%20Sindelfingen">VfL Sindelfingen</a> as winners of the Southern division and <a href="FSV%20G%C3%BCtersloh%202009">FSV Gütersloh 2009</a> as runners-up of the Northern division.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Top scorers.
Ogimi won her first top-scorer award in the Bundesliga (women).
